sen.j: カワマタビメは、綏靖天皇の皇后で安寧天皇の母とされる人物。
sen.e: Kawatabime is the person, who is considered to be a wife of Emperor Suizei and a mother of Emperor Annei.
Kawatabime is considered to have been a wife of Emperor Suizei and a mother of Emperor Annei.
Kawatabime is considered to have been a wife of Emperor Suizei and a mother of Emperor Annei.

sen.j: 『古事記』では河俣毘売といい、師木県主の祖先である家系の出身。
sen.e: She was from the line of ancestor of Shikino agatanushi and is called Kawamatabime in "Kojiki."
She was from the line of ancestor of Shikino agatanushi and is called Kawamatabime in "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters).
She was from the line of ancestor of Shikino agatanushi and is called Kawamatabime in "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters).

sen.j: 師木県主波延（安寧天皇皇后、阿久斗比売の父）の妹。
sen.e: She was a younger sister of Shikino agatanushi hae (a father of Akutohime who became a wife of Emperor Annei).
She was a younger sister of Shikino agatanushi hae (a father of Akutohime who became a wife of Emperor Annei).
She was a younger sister of Shikino agatanushi hae (a father of Akutohime who became a wife of Emperor Annei).
Date of birth and death is unknown,
Dates of birth and death are unknown.
sen.cmt: Dateを複数形に変更。文の最後をピリオドに変更。
sen.e: Dates of birth and death are unknown.

sen.j: 『日本書紀』第1の一書では川派媛といい、磯城県主の娘。
sen.e: She is called Kawamatahime in the volume one of the first book of "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), and a daughter of Shikinoagatanushi.
She is called Kawamatahime in the volume one of the first book of "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), and a daughter of Shikinoagatanushi.
She is called Kawamatahime in the volume one of the first book of "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), and a daughter of Shikinoagatanushi.

sen.j: なお、『日本書紀』本文と第2の一書ではカワマタビメは登場せず、本文では五十鈴依媛命、第2の一では春日県主大日諸の娘である糸織媛が綏靖天皇の皇后とされる。
sen.e: Kawamatabime didn't appear in body of the book and the first volume of the second book of "Nihonshoki", and in body of the book, Isuzuyori hime no mikoto was considered to be a wife of Emperor Suizei, while in the first volume of the second book, Itoorihime, a daughter of Kasugano agatanushi Ohimoro was considered to be a wife of Emperor Suizei respectively.

Kawamatabime does not appear in body of the book and the first volume of the second book of Nihonshoki, and in body of the book, Isuzuyori hime no mikoto is considered to have been a wife of Emperor Suizei, while in the first volume of the second book, Itoorihime, a daughter of Kasugano agatanushi Ohimoro is considered to have been a wife of Emperor Suizei, respectively.

Kawamatabime does not appear in body of the book and the first volume of the second book of Nihonshoki, and in body of the book, Isuzuyori hime no mikoto is considered to have been a wife of Emperor Suizei, while in the first volume of the second book, Itoorihime, a daughter of Kasugano agatanushi Ohimoro is considered to have been a wife of Emperor Suizei, respectively.

sen.j: 欠史八代のため実在しないと考えられている。
sen.e: She was one of Kesshi-Hachidai (Eight Undocumented Sovereigns) and considered to be the nonexistent Emperor.
It is understood that she was one of Kesshi-Hachidai (Eight Undocumented Sovereigns) and was a nonexistent empress.
sen.cmt: emperorをempressに変更、その他表現の見直し
sen.e: It is understood that she was one of Kesshi-Hachidai (Eight Undocumented Sovereigns) and was a nonexistent empress.
